    • This is the Version 2.0.0 Release of the USCoreR4 Implementation Guide, based on FHIR Version 3.6.0. See the Directory of published versions

    Profiles and Extensions

    Profiles

    The following Profiles and have been defined for this implementation guide.

  • New US Core Diagnostic Report Profile for Report and Note exchange
  • New US Core DocumentReference Profile
  • US Core AllergyIntolerance Profile
  • US Core CarePlan Profile
  • US Core CareTeam Profile
  • US Core Condition Profile
  • US Core Device Profile
  • US Core DiagnosticReport Profile
  • US Core DocumentReference Profile
  • US Core Encounter Profile
  • US Core Goal Profile
  • US Core Immunization Profile
  • US Core Location Profile
  • US Core Medication Profile
  • US Core MedicationRequest Profile
  • US Core MedicationStatement Profile
  • US Core Organization Profile
  • US Core Patient Profile
  • US Core Practitioner Profile
  • US Core PractitionerRole Profile
  • US Core Procedure Profile
  • US Core Result Observation Profile
  • US Core Smoking Status Observation Profile
    • In addition US Core uses the Vital Signs Profile from the FHIR Specification.


    Extensions

    The following Extensions have been defined as part of the US Core implementation Guide. A registry of standard extensions can be found in the FHIR specification and additional extensions may be registered on the HL7 FHIR registry at http://hl7.org/fhir/registry.

  • US Core Race Extension
  • Profile-resource association extension
  • US Core ethnicity Extension
  • US Core Direct email Extension
  • US Core Birth Sex Extension
